definitions.definition: compel observance of or compliance with (a law, rule, or obligation).
examples: impose, apply, administer, implement, bring to bear, discharge, execute, prosecute More"the sheriff enforced the law"force, compel, coerce, exact, extort; archaicconstrain "they cannot enforce cooperation between the parties"Morethe sheriff enforced the lawforce, compel, coerce, exact, extort; constrain they cannot enforce cooperation between the parties

definitions.definition: cause (something) to happen by necessity or force.
examples: there is no outside agency to enforce cooperation between the players
